page.title: 06Residential Area Bridlington
page.content: In and around the centre there is a lot of Victorian and Edwardian property. many of these are used for holiday accomodation of one kind or another. There are a number of imposing terraces. More expensive, larger, private housing is to be found to the south of the town along Kingsgate. As one goes from here towards the A166 along Bessingby road West Hill council estate can be seen to the left. This is a fairly modern, but not expanding estate of mixed housing; low flats and two storey semi-detached houses. There is a small row of shops together with an open space community centre. New Pasture Lane is a more recent estate to the north west of the town and is a mixture of private and council houses and a small number of bungalows.
